title: Xamarin Forms Draw Image from platforms resources respective folders - android, ios
body:
Hi there,

Just quick question, I have a Xamarin Forms app and I am using SkiaSharp. I want to be able to draw an icon in my forms project using a icon in my respective drawable folders from my android project and resources in iOS project

What would the implementation look like for this in the Forms project? 

I was also looking into the sample project and it looks like a media folder is created and images placed in there but i am hoping to use the icons in my platforms respective resource folders.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I was putting something together for this here:
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/compare/dev/resource-extensions

I am not actually sure if this code is actually running at all, but you could use this for inspiration. You should be able to register a dependency service (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/app-fundamentals/dependency-service/introduction) with the code in the meantime.

comments.author: LeoJHarris
comments.body: @mattleibow thats great will check that out, although any reason why that cant be merged?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Closing this as I don't think this is going to happen any time soon. This is very platform specific, and also very app model specific. Also, this is also very app specific. For example, on Android, there are resources and assets. Then embedded resources. And Forms has some embedded font attributes.

The best way for now would be to create a dependency service to return the data/bytes/image.
